comments.body: Can we drop the individual node support for now, or label it as experimental? It's a matter of shipping features I don't necessarily want to support for eternity.
Added warning that this feature is experimental

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +29,33 @@
function usage() {
  echo "${0} [-m|-n <node id>] <version>"
  echo "  Updates Kurnetes binaries. Can be done for all components (by default), master(-m) or specified node(-n)."
  echo "  If the version is not specified will try to use local binaries."

comments.body:
How to deal with the node which acts as master as well, if i may ask? Here I assume a traditional master contains control plane only and doesnt have `kubelet` & `kube-proxy` (Correct me if i'm wrong)
@piosz
Since it's kinda a terminology question, i should make myself more clear. When we talk about _master_, is it referring to a node with or w/o working role (with or w/o kubelet & kube-proxy running)?

We run the master components (the apiserver, controller manager, scheduler, etcd) inside of pods managed by kubelets on a node colloquially referred to as "the master". So "the master" node (at least on GCE) runs a kubelet to manage the master components, but it doesn't run kube-proxy.
Yet for other platform, it could be good enough to run master components w/o kubelet (bare-metal ubuntu for instance). Hence my guess is that _master_ is not a strict term technologically.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +57,61 @@
if [[ "${push_to_master}" == "true" ]] && [[ "${push_to_node}" == "true" ]]; then
  echo "Only one of options -m -n should be specified"
  usage
  exit 1
